item.title: Pipes left here, 13th December
item.description:
Pipes have been left here for weeks. It is not only unsightly but a trip hazard.

item.title: Furniture dumped, 13th December
item.description:
What appears to be clearance of seating from a commercial premises has been dumped in front of power substation, blocking access. It has been there for approx. seven days, and is the latest in a succession of dumping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Page's Walk, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, no MOT no Tax, 13th December
item.description:

item.title: Stop line completely invisible, 13th December
item.description:
Stop line and all lines have completely faded and are virtually invisible. At night and in the rain they cannot be seen and people are driving straight through red lights. Very dangerous. Needs re painting urgently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cooks Ferry Roundabout, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish strewn in front of shops, 13th December
item.description:
People from the flats above dump there rubbish by the bin every couple of days and this is how it ends up . Not a good look for the shops on westmount road .... Disgusting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westmount Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess litter, 13th December
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish (Crown Pub), 13th December
item.description:
Full of rubbish abandoned next to the Crown pub, nobody clean it, nor the Council or the pub

item.title: Remove bin please, 13th December
item.description:
Reported AUG '25. STILL nothing done. No response to my report. ref: 7975973. This bin continues to be fly tipped at. People throw excrement bag around the bin as it has no lid. I have seen rats there. It's a health hazard. please remove the bin!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trolley (KFC food), 13th December
item.description:
Abandoned trolley full of KFC stuff, it's here since 10 days and the swipers never cleaned it

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodland Grove, Greenwich

item.description:
This vehicle has been abandoned 18 months ago, never moved, I think it's stolen

item.title: Clothing, bedding and other rubbish dumped on Winn’s Common, 13th December
item.description:
These items have been here for well over a week but it seems like it’s getting worse, with a new dump of rubbish (empty tins etc). It is off the main bit of Winn’s Common, on a side path, next to Bleak Hill Lane.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bleak Hill Lane, Plumstead

item.title: Dumped rubbish on council land, 13th December
item.description:
Dumped rubbish on council land Previous rubbish has been cleared fr this spot by council over last 6 months regularly I have received Email fr you saying it’s private org but it is NOT. If it was why are there 5 Southwark signs in this area!? Like the two I have included here. I have spoken to local Councillor too who has confirmed it’s Southwark land not private Please remove rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-24, Monteagle Way, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shutter full of tags, 13th December
item.description:
Please offer cleaning service. Owner shuts up shop and hasn’t got to see this eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Melbourne Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing bin lid, 13th December
item.description:
The lid of the bin from 7a Blythe Close is missing. This allows for the fixes to access and drag the rubbish out and litter across the gardens and street. This has been going on for a couple of years. I even requested twice over the years for a new bin from council website and nothing happened.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7/7A, Blythe Close, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ref 8533768, 13th December
item.description:
Reported as fixed. Bag is still now on pavement. Just past Canada Rd. Has not been resolved as stated in an e mail to me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Slade Green, Greater London
